1.brief: properly, to glitter from afar, i.e. to be eminent (as a superintendent, especially of the Temple services and its music); to be permanent
David, the youngest son of Jesse
properly, instrumental music; by implication, a poem set to notes
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to penetrate; hence, to examine intimately

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

2.brief: thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
remote, literally or figuratively, of place or time; specifically, precious; often used adverbially (with preposition)

3.brief: a well-trodden road (literally or figuratively); also a caravan
to toss about; by implication, to diffuse, winnow
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
to be familiar with; by implication, to minister to, be serviceable to, be customary

4.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

5.brief: the hinder part; hence (adverb) behind, backward; also (as facing north) the West
the front, of place (absolutely, the fore part, relatively the East) or time (antiquity); often used adverbially (before, anciently, eastward)
to cramp, i.e. confine (in many applications, literally and figuratively, formative or hostile)
to place (in a very wide application)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power

6.brief: properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
to be (causatively, make) lofty, especially inaccessible; by implication, safe, strong; used literally and figuratively
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be able, literally (can, could) or morally (may, might)

7.brief: where?; hence, whither?, when?; also hither and thither
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
where?; hence, whither?, when?; also hither and thither
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to bolt, i.e. figuratively, to flee suddenly

8.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates

9.brief: to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
an edge or extremity; specifically (of a bird or army) a wing, (of a garment or bedclothing) a flap, (of the earth) a quarter, (of a building) a pinnacle
to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)
the last or end, hence, the future; also posterity

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south

10.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to guide; by implication, to transport (into exile, or as colonists)
to seize (often with the accessory idea of holding in possession)
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south

11.brief: a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness
properly, to gape, i.e. snap at; figuratively, to overwhelm
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
in up to or over against; generally at, beside, among, behind, for, etc.

12.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be dark (as withholding light); transitively, to darken
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to be (causative, make) luminous (literally and metaphorically)
luminousness, i.e. (figuratively) prosperity; also a plant (as being bright)

13.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
to erect, i.e. create; by extension, to procure, especially by purchase (causatively, sell); by implication to own
a kidney (as an essential organ); figuratively, the mind (as the interior self)
properly, to entwine as ascreen; by implication, to fence in, cover over, (figuratively) protect
the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything
a mother (as the bond of the family); in a wide sense (both literally and figuratively (like father))

14.brief: physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
properly, perhaps to separate, i.e. distinguish (literally or figuratively); by implication, to be (causatively, make) great, difficult, wonderful
an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, vehemence, i.e. (with or without preposition) vehemently; by implication, wholly, speedily, etc. (often with other words as an intensive or superlative; especially when repeated)

15.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to secrete, by act or word; hence (intensively) to destroy
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
a cover (in a good or a bad, a literal or a figurative sense)
to variegate color, i.e. embroider; by implication, to fabricate
lowermost; as noun (feminine plural) the depths (figuratively, a pit, the womb)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

16.brief: a wrapped (and unformed mass, i.e. as the embryo)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, writing (the art or a document); by implication, a book
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to grave, by implication, to write (describe, inscribe, prescribe, subscribe)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to mould into a form; especially as apotter; figuratively, to determine (i.e. form a resolution)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first

17.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
properly, apparently, to be heavy, i.e. (figuratively) valuable; causatively, to make rare (figuratively, to inhibit)
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to bind fast, i.e. close (the eyes); intransitively, to be (causatively, make) powerful or numerous; to crunch the bones
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)

18.brief: properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)

19.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
properly, to cut off, i.e. (figuratively) put to death
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

20.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
a plan, usually evil (machination), sometimes good (sagacity)
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
evil (as destructive), literally (ruin) or morally (especially guile); figuratively idolatry (as false, subjective), uselessness (as deceptive, objective; also adverbially, in vain)

21.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to cut off, i.e. (figuratively) detest

22.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

23.brief: properly, to penetrate; hence, to examine intimately
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
the heart (as the most interior organ);
to test (especially metals); generally and figuratively, to investigate

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

24.brief: to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
an idol (as fashioned); also pain (bodily or mental)
to guide; by implication, to transport (into exile, or as colonists)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
